Based on your preferences for animation and a deeper storyline, I would recommend "Space Jam" (1996) directed by Jerry Bruckheimer.

This movie is a classic example of an animated sports film. It features some of the biggest names in basketball, including Michael Jordan, who plays a key role in the movie.

The plot of "Space Jam" follows closely to the real-life NBA championship match between the Los Angeles Lakers and the Boston Celtics. The movie even includes footage from that match.

Overall, "Space Jam" is an entertaining and memorable animated sports film. It features some of the biggest names in basketball and includes footage from the real-life NBA championship match between the Los Angeles Lakers and the Boston Celtics.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Life Before Her Eyes" (2007) to them.
"The Life Before Her Eyes" is a drama film that tells the story of a woman who wakes up in a hospital bed with no memory of how she got there. As she tries to piece together her past, she realizes that something sinister may have played a role in her past.
The film stars Lynn Cohen as Sarah and has received positive reviews from critics for its compelling storyline, well-developed characters, and effective direction by Nancy Updike.
Overall, "The Life Before Her Eyes" is a highly recommended drama film that tells an engaging and suspenseful story about a woman who wakes up in a hospital bed with no memory of how she got there.
